intro: Megalastrum galapagense, commonly known as the Galápagos megalastrum, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, often found near the shoreline. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in the region.
